title: Will the SEC’s New ETF Rule Benefit Investors?
text:
The $4 trillion exchange-traded fund industry has, for the last 27 years, operated via a quirk in the law. After some dramatic back-and-forth this week, the Securities and Exchange Commission has finally changed that.

The 2,273 ETFs on the market today have essentially been created via a loophole in the law that governs mutual funds and other investment products for individual investors. description: The $4 trillion exchange-traded fund industry has, for 27 years, operated as an exception to securities law. Not anymore—the Securities and Exchange Commission passed the “ETF Rule” on Thursday that evens the playing field.
